original: longs spyod srung ba dang ; sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod srung ba dang ; sgrub pa'o //

original: gzhan las gyur pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: bgo skal la spyod pa rnams dang / rang gi khyim nas byung ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal can rnams so //

original: yo byad nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyi mdo ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yo byad nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyi mdo ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the provision of requisites is the same as before.

analyzed: yang dag pa'i gnas sbyin pa'i don gyi mdo ni bsam pa gang gis yongs su sdud pa dang / sbyor ba gang gis yongs su sdud pa'o //

original: de la bsam pa gang gis yongs su sdud ce na /
analyzed: de la bsam pa gang gis yongs su sdud ce na /
translated: What is the intention with which one gives?

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: It is the intention of non-greed.

original: sbyor ba gang gis yongs su sdud ce na /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis yongs su sdud ce na /
translated: What is the application with which one gives?

original: chos dang zang zing gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing gnyis kyis so //

original: de la zang zing gis yongs su bsdu ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la zang zing gis yongs su bsdu ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: pha rol las btsal ba dang / bdag gi yo byad thun mong du byed pa'o //

original: chos kyis yongs su bsdu ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos kyis yongs su bsdu ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The gathering of disciples by means of the Dharma is also twofold:

original: gdams ngag sbyin pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag sbyin pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: giving instructions and teaching the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi sems dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i don gyi mdo las sems dang mthun par byed pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i don gyi mdo las sems dang mthun par byed pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The sutra on the meaning of accord with the minds of others says that accord with the minds of others is extensive and has divisions.

original: de la don gyi mdo las ni bsam pa dang / rang bzhin yongs su shes nas sems can gang dag gis ji ltar lhan cig gnas par bya ba de ltar de dag dang gnas so //
analyzed: de la don gyi mdo las ni bsam pa dang / rang bzhin yongs su shes nas sems can gang dag gis ji ltar lhan cig gnas par bya ba de ltar de dag dang gnas so //
translated: In that sutra, it says that after understanding the inclinations and natures of sentient beings, one should live with them in whatever way is suitable for living with them.

original: sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de ltar de dag la sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de ltar de dag la sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba de la /
translated: One should practice with them in whatever way is suitable for practicing with them.

original: bsam pa ni da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i sems so //
translated: Attitude is the mind generated by the present condition.

original: rang bzhin ni tshe snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni tshe snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Nature is the essence that arises from the cause of the previous life.

original: yang na bsam pa ni sems can rnams kyi sems can so so'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsam pa ni sems can rnams kyi sems can so so'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'o //
translated: Or else, attitude is the individual natures of the minds of sentient beings.

original: rang bzhin ni sems can thams cad kyi sems 'jug pa thun mong ba ste ;üîΩbsam pa dang rang bzhin shes nas lhan cig 'grogs par bya zhing /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni sems can thams cad kyi sems 'jug pa thun mong ba ste ; bsam pa dang rang bzhin shes nas lhan cig 'grogs par bya zhing /
translated: Nature is the common engagement of the minds of all sentient beings.üîΩHaving understood attitude and nature, one should associate with sentient beings.

original: bsam pa dang rang bzhin shes nas sems can rnams la bsgrub par bya'o //üîΩde la bsam pa shes nas gnas pa dang / sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas sems can gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs @186a * //
analyzed: bsam pa dang rang bzhin shes nas sems can rnams la bsgrub par bya'o // de la bsam pa shes nas gnas pa dang / sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas sems can gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs @186a * //
translated: Having understood attitude and nature, one should practice with regard to sentient beings.

original: pa'i gzhung brtsams so //
analyzed: pa'i gzhung brtsams so //
translated: Regarding that, having understood attitude and nature, in terms of abiding and practice, the text is composed beginning with By which sentient being...

original: gzhung gi don gyi mdo ni /
analyzed: gzhung gi don gyi mdo ni /
translated: The summary of the meaning of the text is:

original: phan min bslab pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: phan min bslab pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for the training that is not beneficial,

original: gang gis pha rol sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: gang gis pha rol sdug bsngal ba /
translated: By which others suffer,

original: de dang gzhan dang bdag la yang /
analyzed: de dang gzhan dang bdag la yang /
translated: For oneself, others, and both,

original: dngos po de ni de mi spyod //
analyzed: dngos po de ni de mi spyod //
translated: That thing is not to be practiced.

original: ces bya'o // sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba de nas bzung ste /üîΩgzhan khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung ni rang bzhin shes nas sems can gang dag dang ji ltar lhan cig gnas par bya ba dang sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya
analyzed: ces bya'o // sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba de nas bzung ste / gzhan khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung ni rang bzhin shes nas sems can gang dag dang ji ltar lhan cig gnas par bya ba dang sems can gang dag la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya
translated: From the line ‚ÄúThose sentient beings with whom one should practice in such a way‚Äù up to

original: ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äúone should not show oneself to those who are bound by the fetters of anger,‚Äù the text is concerned with the question of how one should live with those sentient beings and how one should practice in relation to those sentient beings, having understood their natures.

original: gzhung 'di'i don gyi mdo ni yid kyi las bsgrub pa dang / ngag gi las bsgrub pa dang / lus kyi las bsgrub pa'o //üîΩde la yid kyi las sgrub pa'i dbang du byas te khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'di'i don gyi mdo ni yid kyi las bsgrub pa dang / ngag gi las bsgrub pa dang / lus kyi las bsgrub pa'o // de la yid kyi las sgrub pa'i dbang du byas te khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The gist of this text is the practice of mental action, the practice of verbal action, and the practice of physical action.

original: bdag nyid mthong bar mi ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid mthong bar mi ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du smos so //
translated: With regard to the practice of mental action, the text says ‚Äúto those who are bound by the fetters of anger‚Äù up to ‚Äúone should not show oneself to those who are bound by the fetters of anger.‚Äù

original: yid kyi las bsgrub pa yang gnyi ga dang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las bsgrub pa yang gnyi ga dang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The mental action of accomplishment is to be applied in the same way to both.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba sems sgrub pa'i gnas skabs kyis 'dul ba de la rang gi sems sgrub cing 'khrug kyang mi 'khrug la sma yang 'bebs par byed de /
analyzed: khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba sems sgrub pa'i gnas skabs kyis 'dul ba de la rang gi sems sgrub cing 'khrug kyang mi 'khrug la sma yang 'bebs par byed de /
translated: In the case of the one who is disciplined by the state of mind of the fetter called anger, he accomplishes his own mind, and he does not become angry even when others are angry with him and insult him.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The same is to be applied in the same way to others.

original: lus kyi las sgrub pa las brtsams te gzhan dag la mi rten par yang mi byed ha cang rten par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi las sgrub pa las brtsams te gzhan dag la mi rten par yang mi byed ha cang rten par yang mi byed do //
translated: In the case of the accomplishment of physical action, he does not rely on others and he does not rely on them too much.

original: ngag gi las sgrub pa las brtsams te mdun du mdza' bo las smod par yang mi byed ces bya ba nas chos dang mthun par bshad kyi byang bar byed do //
analyzed: ngag gi las sgrub pa las brtsams te mdun du mdza' bo las smod par yang mi byed ces bya ba nas chos dang mthun par bshad kyi byang bar byed do //
translated: In the case of the accomplishment of verbal action, he does not criticize his friends in front of others, and so on up to: he explains things in accordance with the Dharma and he is skilled in making others understand.

original: yang dag par yon tan gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i don gyi mdo ni dad pa la sogs pa de dag kho nar zad de /
analyzed: yang dag par yon tan gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i don gyi mdo ni dad pa la sogs pa de dag kho nar zad de /
translated: The meaning of the sutra on the true qualities that truly delight is just those very things such as faith.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lnga po kho na sdud pa'i rgyu yin par 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lnga po kho na sdud pa'i rgyu yin par 'og nas ston to //
translated: The five beginning with faith are the causes of inclusion, as will be taught later.

original: tshar bcad pa'i don gyi mdo ni nyes pa dang / 'gal ba rnam pa gsum yod pa las nyes pa ji lta ba bzhin du sma dbab pa dang chad ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: tshar bcad pa'i don gyi mdo ni nyes pa dang / 'gal ba rnam pa gsum yod pa las nyes pa ji lta ba bzhin du sma dbab pa dang chad ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The sutra on the meaning of punishment: There are three kinds of faults and contradictions. The three kinds of punishment are for the three kinds of faults.

original: spang ba la ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spang ba la ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of expulsion:

original: de dag nyid phyir dgug par bya ba dang / 'grogs par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid phyir dgug par bya ba dang / 'grogs par mi bya ba'o //
translated: to be expelled and not to be associated with.

original: de la nyes pa ni bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyes pa ni bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, a fault is not doing what should be done.

original: 'gal ba ni bya ba mi rigs @186b ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni bya ba mi rigs @186b ba byed pa'o //
translated: A contradiction is doing what should not be done.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi don gyi mdo ni skrag par bya ba dang / 'dun par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi don gyi mdo ni skrag par bya ba dang / 'dun par bya ba'o //
translated: The sutra on the meaning of spiritual powers: to frighten and to inspire.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims mang bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims mang bar bstan to //
translated: The phrase the three kinds of aggregates of morality teaches the abundance of morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob pa de bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob pa de bstan to //
translated: The phrase in the training of the bodhisattvas teaches what the bodhisattvas are training in.

original: gang gis rnam par rig byed kyi don 'dzin pa dang / go bar nus pa la thugs brtse ba'i slad du cung zad cig gsan cing thugs brtse ba'i slad du stsal ba'i rigs so zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par rig byed kyi don 'dzin pa dang / go bar nus pa la thugs brtse ba'i slad du cung zad cig gsan cing thugs brtse ba'i slad du stsal ba'i rigs so zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should add: In order to hear and to give with compassion to those who are able to grasp and understand the meaning of the expression, and in order to give with compassion to those who are not able to grasp and understand the meaning of the expression.

original: ye shes dang mthu chen po thob pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni zab pa dang rgya che ba dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes dang mthu chen po thob pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni zab pa dang rgya che ba dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: Those who have attained great knowledge and power indicates the profundity and vast extent of the teaching.

original: mchod pa byas pa ni me tog dang / bdug pa dang spos la sogs pa dang / bstod pa brjod pa dang / phyag bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa byas pa ni me tog dang / bdug pa dang spos la sogs pa dang / bstod pa brjod pa dang / phyag bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa'o //
translated: Worship is worship with flowers, incense, perfume, etc., with praises, prostrations, etc.

original: ci nus pa dang rgyu'i stobs ci yod pas zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa de da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu'i rtsal dang / 'das pa'i tshe rabs na byas pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bur bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ci nus pa dang rgyu'i stobs ci yod pas zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa de da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu'i rtsal dang / 'das pa'i tshe rabs na byas pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bur bstan pa'o //
translated: To the best of one's ability and with whatever strength of cause one has indicates the power of the person present in the generation of the thought, and the fruit of the cause made in former lives.

original: gal te 'bogs pa ni chos mtshungs pa khyim pa zhig yin na ni rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bogs pa ni chos mtshungs pa khyim pa zhig yin na ni rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the one who is to be sprinkled is a householder of the same Dharma, he is called son of good family.

original: yang na rab tu byung ba na yang gal te gzhon nu zhig yin na tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rab tu byung ba na yang gal te gzhon nu zhig yin na tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, if he is a monk, then if he is young, he is called ‚Äúvenerable‚Äù;

original: ci ste rgan pa zhig yin na ni btsun pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste rgan pa zhig yin na ni btsun pa zhes bya ste /
translated: but if he is old, he is called ‚Äúmaster.‚Äù

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is shown by this?

original: rab tu byung ba 'ba' zhig dang / rgan pa nyi tshe las gnod par bya bar nges pa med par bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'ba' zhig dang / rgan pa nyi tshe las gnod par bya bar nges pa med par bstan pa'i don to //
translated: It is shown that it is not certain that only monks and the old are to be harmed.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi gang yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po re re la bslab pa'i gzhi so so ba gang dag yod pa de dag go //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi gang yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po re re la bslab pa'i gzhi so so ba gang dag yod pa de dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe bases of training‚Äù are the individual bases of training in each of the three kinds of morality.

original: tshul khrims gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúMorality‚Äù is the three kinds of morality.

original: ye shes gzigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes gzigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge and insight‚Äù means

original: ye shes ni lkog tu gyur pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni lkog tu gyur pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: knowledge is the apprehension of the hidden,

original: gzigs pa ni dngos po mngon sum du gyur pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni dngos po mngon sum du gyur pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and insight is the apprehension of the manifest.

original: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi zhes bya ba 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi zhes bya ba 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is shown by the four dharmas that are grounds for defeat?

original: 'di la gnas pas na gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la gnas pas na gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúground‚Äù is used because one dwells on it.

original: pham pa rnams kyi gnas ni pham pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: pham pa rnams kyi gnas ni pham pa'i gnas so //
translated: The ground of defeat is the ground of the defeated.

analyzed: pham pa rnams kyi gnas de gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang la brten na pham pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that on which the defeated dwell.

original: gang la brten te 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩ'dod @187a * //
analyzed: gang la brten te 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na / 'dod @187a * //
translated: On what do they dwell?üîΩThey dwell on desire,

original: chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: hatred, and ignorance.

original: chos bzhi ji ltar gsum la brten te 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: chos bzhi ji ltar gsum la brten te 'byung zhe na /
translated: How do the four dharmas arise in dependence on the three?

original: 'dod chags la rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there are two kinds of desire.

analyzed: 'dod chags rnam pa gnyis ni 'khrig pa'i dngos po la 'dod chags dang / dngos po gzhan la 'dod chags so //
translated: There are two kinds of desire: desire for sexual intercourse and desire for other things.

analyzed: de la 'khrig pa'i dngos po la 'dod chags la brten pa las ni pham pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dang po'o //
translated: The first ground of training in the precepts for the defeated arises in dependence on desire for sexual intercourse.

original: dngos po gzhan la 'dod chags la brten pa las ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la 'dod chags la brten pa las ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second arises in dependence on desire for other things.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na pham pa rnams kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na pham pa rnams kyi gnas yin te /
translated: In one sense, they are the basis of defeat.

original: pham pa'i chos gang la gnas pa bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa chen po la gnas so //
analyzed: pham pa'i chos gang la gnas pa bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa chen po la gnas so //
translated: They are the basis of defeat because one who abides in the quality of defeat abides in the great basis of training.

original: de dang mthun pa rnams ni pham pa'i gnas lta bu rnams te /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa rnams ni pham pa'i gnas lta bu rnams te /
translated: The similar are like the basis of defeat.

analyzed: de dag gi gnas lta bu nyid chen po'i gnas ni 'di dag gi yang yin no //
translated: They are like the basis of defeat because they are the basis of the great basis.

original: de lta bas na chos bzhi po 'di dag ni pham pa'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos bzhi po 'di dag ni pham pa'i gnas lta bu zhes bya ste /

original: dper na sdom pa'i tshul khrims chen po'i chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir pham pa'i gnas lta bu zhes bya'i rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig ste /

translated: But they are not in all respects like the basis of defeat.

original: de ni 'og nas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas bstan to //
translated: This will be explained below.

analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba bsnyen par rdzogs pas bslab pa ma phul bar 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pas nyes pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Whatever fault is incurred by a listener who is fully ordained by engaging in sexual intercourse without relinquishing the training,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen te /
translated: They are attached to gain and honor.

original: bdag la stod pa dang gzhan la smod pas thob par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //

analyzed: de la 'phel ba ni 'di ltar 'di ni la la nyes pa gcig nas gnyis dang gsum dang lnga'i bar du byas kyang chos bzhin du phyir 'chos par mi byed pa de ni sogs pa las nyes pa chung ngur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The increase is as follows: If one commits one, two, three, or up to five faults, but does not confess them in accordance with the Dharma, then the fault becomes small due to the accumulation.

original: de yan chad nyes pa bcu'am /üîΩnyi shu'am / sum cu 'am /üîΩyang shes par bya nus pa'i bar du byas la chos bzhin du phyir 'tshos @189a * //
analyzed: de yan chad nyes pa bcu'am / nyi shu'am / sum cu 'am / yang shes par bya nus pa'i bar du byas la chos bzhin du phyir 'tshos @189a * //
translated: The increase of that is as follows: If someone commits one, two, three, or up to five faults, but does not make amends according to the Dharma, that is a minor fault due to accumulation.

original: par yang mi byed pa de ni sogs pa las nyes pa 'bring du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: par yang mi byed pa de ni sogs pa las nyes pa 'bring du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If he commits ten, twenty, thirty, or more faults, but does not make amends according to the Dharma, that should be known as a medium fault due to accumulation.

original: nyes pa tshad med pa 'byung la nyes pa 'di tsam zhig 'byung ngo zhes shes par mi nus pa gang yin pa de ni sogs pa las nyes pa chen por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa tshad med pa 'byung la nyes pa 'di tsam zhig 'byung ngo zhes shes par mi nus pa gang yin pa de ni sogs pa las nyes pa chen por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If he commits faults beyond measure, to the point where it is impossible to know how many faults there are, that should be known as a great fault due to accumulation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yang 'byung ba pa dang / rims nad dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shir 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni de la tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa phyi ma phyi ma grub pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yang 'byung ba pa dang / rims nad dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shir 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni de la tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa phyi ma phyi ma grub pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The mental afflictions are so called because they afflict the mind.

original: tshe phyi ma la yang srid pa 'grub pa'i phyir yang 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la yang srid pa 'grub pa'i phyir yang 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The states of rebirth are so called because they are the states in which one is reborn.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pas na rims nad dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pas na rims nad dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The diseases are so called because they are the diseases of the mental afflictions.üîΩThe suffering of the karmic maturation is so called because it is the suffering that is the karmic maturation of the mental afflictions.

original: yang 'byung ba rnams yod pas na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba rnams yod pas na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: The future birth and old age and death are so called because they are the future birth and old age and death that are caused by the mental afflictions.

original: tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba rnams kyis lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba rnams kyis lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The disadvantages of the defilements in this life are the burning of the body and mind by the defilements, and the disadvantages in the next life are the going to bad destinies.

original: yang 'byung ba pa rnams yod pas na phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa rnams yod pas na phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur te /
translated: The disadvantages of birth, aging and death in the next life are due to the existence of the future.

original: yun ring por rga shi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por rga shi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they generate birth, aging and death for a long time.

original: dka' ba'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni thog ma len pa dang bsrung ba'i phyir dka' bar bstan to //
analyzed: dka' ba'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni thog ma len pa dang bsrung ba'i phyir dka' bar bstan to //
translated: The summary of the meaning of difficult morality is taught as difficult because of taking it up and protecting it.

original: de la srung ba ni nyams thag par gyur kyang srung ba dang gtan du srung ba'o //
analyzed: de la srung ba ni nyams thag par gyur kyang srung ba dang gtan du srung ba'o //
translated: Therein, protection is the protection of the vows even when they are damaged, and the perpetual protection.

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni tshe 'di'i sbyor ba dang / thog ma med pa'i dus kyi sa bon dang / 'das pa'i tshe rabs dag tu thog ma med pa'i dus kyi sa bon yang dag par sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni tshe 'di'i sbyor ba dang / thog ma med pa'i dus kyi sa bon dang / 'das pa'i tshe rabs dag tu thog ma med pa'i dus kyi sa bon yang dag par sgrub pa dang /
translated: The summary of the meaning of morality in all aspects is the application in this life, the seed from beginningless time, and the establishment of the seed from beginningless time in past lives.

original: tshul khrims de yang dag par brten nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims de yang dag par brten nas 'byung ba ste /

analyzed: de phyir thams cad kyi sgor bstan to //

original: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni bdag dang gzhan sgrub pa dang / nyes pa byung na chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni bdag dang gzhan sgrub pa dang / nyes pa byung na chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the morality of the holy person is to accomplish oneself and others and, when a fault occurs, to restore it according to the Dharma.

original: de la bdag dang gzhan sgrub pa ni thog mar bdag gis tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa yang dag par len pa dang / gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan sgrub pa ni thog mar bdag gis tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa yang dag par len pa dang / gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Of these, accomplishing oneself and others is, first, to take up morality oneself and to cause others to take it up.

original: gzhan dag gis tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dag la sgrub pa @189b ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dag la sgrub pa @189b ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two ways of accomplishing the morality taken up by others:

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod pas tshig gis yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / de mthong na yang sems kyis rab tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: to delight them verbally by praising morality and to delight them mentally by being pleased when one sees them.

original: bdag gis bslab pa'i gzhi yang yang dag par blangs pa dag las nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bslab pa'i gzhi yang yang dag par blangs pa dag las nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'o //
translated: And when one has taken up the bases of training, one does not commit a transgression, or if one does, one confesses it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni yon tan ni du dang ldan /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni yon tan ni du dang ldan /

original: de la yon tan du dang ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la yon tan du dang ldan pa zhe na /

translated: It is vast, as it is applied to the Great Vehicle; it is irreproachable, as it is applied to the absence of false views; it is a basis for delight, as it is applied to the absence of regret; it is constant, as it is applied to the absence of interruption; it is firm, as it is applied to the absence of fear; and it is adorned with morality, as it is applied to the absence of craving for the enjoyments.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' spongs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' spongs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: It is irreproachable, because it avoids the extreme of indulging in the pleasures of desire.

original: bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i phyir tab tu dga' ba lta bu'o //üîΩrnyed pa dang bkur sti dang phas kyi rgol pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i phyir tab tu dga' ba lta bu'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang phas kyi rgol pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing /
translated: It is delightful, because it avoids the extreme of self-mortification.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir brtan pa'o //üîΩdge sbyong gi rgyan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir brtan pa'o // dge sbyong gi rgyan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: It is firm, because it is not overcome by gain and honor or by adversaries, and because it is not carried away by the defilements and secondary defilements.üîΩThese are the ornaments of the religious life.

original: dge sbyong dag gi rgyan rnams ni //
analyzed: dge sbyong dag gi rgyan rnams ni //
translated: The ornaments of the religious life areüîΩfaith, conscientiousness,üîΩmodesty, shame,üîΩfewness of desires,üîΩcontentment,

original: dad pa dang ni g-yo med dang // de bzhin gnod pa chung ba dang // brtson 'grus brtsams dang shes rab dang // 'dod pa chung dang chog shes dang // gso sla ba dang dgang sla ste //
analyzed: dad pa dang ni g-yo med dang // de bzhin gnod pa chung ba dang // brtson 'grus brtsams dang shes rab dang // 'dod pa chung dang chog shes dang // gso sla ba dang dgang sla ste //
translated: ease of support,üîΩease of satisfaction,

original: yon tan de dag ldan pa yin //
analyzed: yon tan de dag ldan pa yin //

analyzed: dang ba nyid dang tshod shes dang // skyes bu dam pa'i chos rnams dang // mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa dang // bzod dang ldan zhing nges pa dang // de la yangs pa nyid dang ldan // de la rnam pa du yod ce na // rnam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba dang / 'bras bu rab tu dbye ba'o // de la ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni // ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang gnyi ga rjes su srung ba'i tshul khrims te / ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba'o // skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par @190a * // byed pa la sogs pa ni 'bras bu rab tu dbye ba ste /

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par byed pa ni dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par byed pa ni dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //

original: lhag pa'i sems rnam par smin par byed pa dang / sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par smin par byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so ;
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems rnam par smin par byed pa dang / sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par smin par byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so ;
translated: The morality of restraint is the cause of the maturation of the higher mind and of the maturation of a good destiny.

original: / sems can gyi don rnam par smin par byed pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: / sems can gyi don rnam par smin par byed pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings is the cause of the maturation of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: phongs shing 'do pa'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni bdag gi nyams las dpag nas gzhan dag la /
analyzed: phongs shing 'do pa'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni bdag gi nyams las dpag nas gzhan dag la /
translated: The meaning of the verse on the morality of difficulty is to be inferred from my own experience and then taught to others.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po dag dang / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las kyi lam du gtogs pa dang lag pa dang bong pas bsnun pa mi sdug pa'i rnam par 'tshe ba'i 'dus te reg pa dag las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po dag dang / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las kyi lam du gtogs pa dang lag pa dang bong pas bsnun pa mi sdug pa'i rnam par 'tshe ba'i 'dus te reg pa dag las ldog pa'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of the seven unwholesome paths of action of body and speech, such as killing, and the avoidance of the unwholesome paths of action of body, such as striking with the hand or a clod of earth, and the avoidance of the unpleasant contact of striking with the hand or a clod of earth.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni 'di dang gzhan du sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la 'jug pa dgag pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu la 'jug pa gnang pa dang / de la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can bsdu ba dang /üîΩde la log par zhugs pa'i sems can tshar bcad pa dang / sems can rnams dang bdag la 'di dang gzhan du bde ba ste ;
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims kyi don gyi mdo ni 'di dang gzhan du sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la 'jug pa dgag pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu la 'jug pa gnang pa dang / de la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can bsdu ba dang / de la log par zhugs pa'i sems can tshar bcad pa dang / sems can rnams dang bdag la 'di dang gzhan du bde ba ste ;
translated: The meaning of morality in this life and the next is to prevent sentient beings from engaging in the causes of suffering in this life and the next, to allow them to engage in the causes of happiness, to gather sentient beings who are correctly engaged in those causes,

original: sems can rnams de la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams de la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: to suppress sentient beings who are wrongly engaged in those causes, and to cause sentient beings and oneself to attain happiness in this life and the next.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni bdag nyid dang gzhan des bsdus pa rnams la 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni bdag nyid dang gzhan des bsdus pa rnams la 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Morality endowed with generosity and so on causes happiness in this life and the next for oneself and others who are attracted by it.

original: rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa bcu'i don gyi mdo ni nyes pa drug rnam par spangs pas de'i gnyen po'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa bcu'i don gyi mdo ni nyes pa drug rnam par spangs pas de'i gnyen po'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the tenfold pure morality is pure because it is endowed with the qualities that are the antidotes to the six faults.

original: nyes pa drug po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa drug po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six faults?

original: bsam pa'i nyes pa dang / sbyor ba'i nyes pa dang / smon pa'i nyes pa dang / gzhan ma dad pa'i nyes pa dang / bdag la phan mi 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang ; 'dod pa'i don mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i nyes pa dang / sbyor ba'i nyes pa dang / smon pa'i nyes pa dang / gzhan ma dad pa'i nyes pa dang / bdag la phan mi 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang ; 'dod pa'i don mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fault of intention, the fault of application, the fault of aspiration, the fault of others' lack of faith, the fault of not benefiting oneself, and the fault of not attaining the desired goal.

original: de la bsam pa'i nyes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i nyes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Among them, the fault of intention is twofold:

original: len pa'i dus na nyes par blangs pa dang / srung ba'i dus na ha cang zhum pa dang / ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa'i dus na nyes par blangs pa dang / srung ba'i dus na ha cang zhum pa dang / ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: at the time of taking, it is taking with a fault, and at the time of guarding, it is excessive laxity or excessive strictness.

original: sbyor ba'i dus na de la sbyor ba mi byed pa dang / bya ba ngan pa gzhan la @190b chags pas ni sbyor ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus na de la sbyor ba mi byed pa dang / bya ba ngan pa gzhan la @190b chags pas ni sbyor ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of application, not applying to that and being attached to other bad actions become the fault of application.

original: tshe 'di la tshe phyi mar log par smon pa'i nyes pa ni smon pa'i nyes pa'o //üîΩdge ba'i phyogs la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad yongs su tshol ba'i dus na gzhan ma dad par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa ni gzhan dag gis smad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: tshe 'di la tshe phyi mar log par smon pa'i nyes pa ni smon pa'i nyes pa'o // dge ba'i phyogs la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad yongs su tshol ba'i dus na gzhan ma dad par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa ni gzhan dag gis smad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The fault of misdirected aspiration is the aspiration for this life in the next life.

original: / bdag sdug bsngal ba la gnas pa'i phyir bdag la phan mi 'dogs pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: / bdag sdug bsngal ba la gnas pa'i phyir bdag la phan mi 'dogs pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fault of being despised by others is the fault of not benefiting oneself because of being occupied with the side of virtue, etc. and because of the time of seeking the necessities of life.

original: 'dod pa'i don mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The fault of not obtaining the desired aim is twofold.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / brten por mi byed pa dang med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / brten por mi byed pa dang med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the fault of not obtaining the desired aim because of not being a natural liberator and because of not being a support for the non-arising of the unarisen and the abandonment of the arisen.

original: de ji skad bstan pa bzhin du mi byed pa'i nyes pa ni 'dod pa'i don mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: de ji skad bstan pa bzhin du mi byed pa'i nyes pa ni 'dod pa'i don mi 'thob pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The fault of not acting in accordance with what one says is the fault of not obtaining the desired aim.

original: nyes pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag rnam par spangs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims zhes ya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag rnam par spangs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims zhes ya'o //
translated: Thus, pure morality is the avoidance of these ten faults.

original: phan yon rnam pa lnga'i don gyi mdo ni 'bras bu lnga'i dbang du byas nas phan yon lnga ste //
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa lnga'i don gyi mdo ni 'bras bu lnga'i dbang du byas nas phan yon lnga ste //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the five benefits is fivefold in terms of the five results.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe buddhas will think of him‚Äù is the dominant result.

original: mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
